Julien Migozzi is an Urban Studies Foundation Postdoctoral Research Fellow at the University of Oxford. 
An urban and economic geographer, his research interests lie at the intersection of financial geography, urban studies and economic sociology. Julien's current project examines how digital technologies reshape real estate markets, focusing on South Africa.

## Participants


::: {.column width="30%"}
![](https://wsrv.nl/?url=https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jmigozzi/masterclass/master/assets/june.jpg&w=200&h=200&fit=cover&mask=circle&maxage=7d)
:::
::: {.column width="10%"}
<!-- empty column to create gap -->
:::
::: {.column width="50%"}
At the University of Cologne in Germany, June Gbadamosi is a Coimbra Group Fellow. She is a research fellow with IFRA and a PhD candidate at the University of Ibadan. Her research interests lie at the intersection of digital cultural identities, media, and African Studies. Her current research focuses on Nigeria and examines how digital indentures are changing cultural and digital environments.
:::
